program: Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS)

sections.text: Brown’s MSCS program develops technical depth and research capacity while encouraging interdisciplinary exploration and innovation in computing.

items: Core courses in algorithms, systems, and theory
Electives in AI, robotics, data science, and HCI
sections.text: The curriculum balances required core areas with flexibility for specialization in advanced CS topics.

items: Bachelor’s degree with strong quantitative or CS background
Competence in programming, algorithms, discrete math, linear algebra, probability
sections.text: Applicants must demonstrate quantitative and computing readiness; strong letters and academic background are essential for admission.
Graduates enter industry in software engineering, data science, or research, or continue to PhD studies.
